laboratory_examinations.findings: Markedly positive serum titers for Borrelia burgdorferi; titer optical density was 0.393 with a negative cutoff of 0.103.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat Lyme serologies indicated higher than normal titers (0.478; 0.117 negative cutoff) after 4 weeks of antibiotic therapy.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal protein and glucose content; negative for white cells and organisms initially. IgM antibodies appeared after 1 month of antibiotic therapy; presence of IgM antibodies consistent with acute Borrelia infection after treatment.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially negative for IgM but showed presence after 1 month of antibiotic therapy.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Scattered punctate foci of signal abnormality in the subcortical white matter, predominantly in the frontal lobes; no ventricular enlargement or abnormal enhancement.
Lower than normal blood flow in the frontotemporal regions bilaterally; no ischemic areas noted.
